paragraphs: On Wednesday, March 9, the first spring fair of the current season opened at Republic Square in the center of Prague (náměstí Republiky). Around 19 stalls will be open for visitors daily until March 27.

They offer products with a spring theme. For example, Easter eggs in original wooden designs, wooden beads, ceramics with plant and animal motifs, tablecloths and blankets with floral patterns, and much more.
There are also traditional treats: pancakes, Czech sausages, roasted almonds, traditional pies, and even dumplings with hearty and sweet fillings.
"We are glad that even in these difficult times we can make people's everyday life a little more pleasant, whether they are going to work or for a walk," said the press service of Taiko company.
The market opener is a kind of precursor to the traditional Easter markets that will start opening throughout Prague (including on the Old Town Square) from April 2nd.
